alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Swisher (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 28 at 5:38PM CDT until May 28 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Briscoe County in the panhandle of Texas... Northeastern Swisher County in the panhandle of Texas... * Until 830 PM CDT. * At 538 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a stationary thunderstorm producing torrential rainfall southwest of Vigo Park. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Vigo Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
